page.title: 05RELIGIOUS LIFE
page.content: The religious life of the village is served by two churches -St. Andrew's C of E. (1254) and the Methodist Chapel. Othe denominations may choose to travel to Gainford, a village two miles east of the village. Attendances are moderate for Sunday services. However, the Harvest Festival service held in September is always well attended by young and old alike. Although once served by its own rector who lived in the nearby rectory, the church is now served by the vicar of Gainford. The old rectory is now a private residence. Its elevated position was said to "command the softest and richest views of the Tees."
